clinical.cTX: El tumor primario no puede ser evaluado. Incluye tumores comprobados por la presencia de células malignas en esputo o lavados bronquiales, pero que no son visualizados mediante imágenes o broncoscopía.
clinical.cT1: Tumor ≤ 3 cm en su dimensión mayor, rodeado por pulmón o pleura visceral, o en un bronquio lobar o más periférico.
clinical.cT1mi: Minimally invasive adenocarcinoma: adenocarcinoma (≤ 3 cm in greatest dimension) with a predominantly lepidic pattern and ≤ 5 mm invasion in greatest dimension
clinical.cT1a: Tumor ≤ 1 cm in greatest dimension OR Tumor of any size whose invasive component is limited to the bronchial wall and may extend proximal to the main bronchus, this is an uncommon superficial, spreading tumor
clinical.cT1b: Tumor > 1 cm but ≤ 2 cm in greatest dimension
clinical.cT1c: Tumor > 2 cm but ≤ 3 cm in greatest dimension
clinical.cT2: Tumor > 3 cm but ≤ 5 cm in greatest dimension; OR Tumor ≤ 4 cm with: Invades visceral pleura, Invades an adjacent lobe, Involves main bronchus (up to but not including the carina); OR associated with atelectasis or obstructive pneumonitis, extending to the hilar regions, involving either part of or the entire lung
clinical.cT2a: Tumor > 3 cm but ≤ 4 cm in greatest dimension OR Tumor ≤ 4 cm in greatest dimension with one or more of the following features: Invades visceral pleura, Invades an adjacent lobe, Involves main bronchus (up to but not including the carina) or associated with atelectasis or obstructive pneumonitis, extending to the hilar regions, involving either part of or the entire lung
clinical.cT2b: Tumor > 4 cm but ≤ 5 cm in greatest dimension with or without any of the following features: Invades visceral pleura, Invades an adjacent lobe, Involves main bronchus (up to but not including the carina) or associated with atelectasis or obstructive pneumonitis, extending to the hilar regions, involving either part of or the entire lung
clinical.cT3: Tumor > 5 cm but ≤ 7 cm in greatest dimension OR Tumor ≤ 7 cm with one or more of the following features: Invades parietal pleura or chest wall, Invades pericardium, phrenic nerve or azygos vein, Invades thoracic nerve roots (i.e., T1, T2) or stellate ganglion, Separate tumor nodule(s) in the same lobe as the primary
clinical.cT4: Tumor > 7 cm in greatest dimension; OR Tumor of any size with: Invades mediastinum, thymus, trachea, carina, recurrent laryngeal nerve, vagus nerve, esophagus or diaphragm, Invades heart, great vessels, supra-aortic arteries or brachiocephalic veins, Invades subclavian vessels, vertebral body, lamina, spinal canal, cervical nerve roots or brachial plexus, Separate tumor nodule(s) in a different ipsilateral lobe

pathological.pTX: Primary tumor cannot be assessed. Includes tumors proven by the presence of malignant cells in sputum or bronchial washings but not visualized by imaging or bronchoscopy
pathological.pTis: Carcinoma in situ. Squamous cell carcinoma in situ (SCIS). Adenocarcinoma in situ (AIS): adenocarcinoma with pure lepidic pattern, ≤ 3 cm in greatest dimension
pathological.pT1: Tumor ≤ 3 cm en su dimensión mayor, rodeado por pulmón o pleura visceral, o en un bronquio lobar o más periférico
pathological.pT1mi: Minimally invasive adenocarcinoma: adenocarcinoma (≤ 3 cm in greatest dimension) with a predominantly lepidic pattern and ≤ 5 mm invasion in greatest dimension
pathological.pT1a: Tumor ≤ 1 cm in greatest dimension OR Tumor of any size whose invasive component is limited to the bronchial wall and may extend proximal to the main bronchus
pathological.pT1b: Tumor > 1 cm but ≤ 2 cm in greatest dimension
pathological.pT1c: Tumor > 2 cm but ≤ 3 cm in greatest dimension
pathological.pT2: Tumor > 3 cm but ≤ 5 cm in greatest dimension OR Tumor ≤ 4 cm with features: Invades visceral pleura, Invades an adjacent lobe, Involves main bronchus, or associated with atelectasis/pneumonitis
pathological.pT2a: Tumor > 3 cm but ≤ 4 cm in greatest dimension OR Tumor ≤ 4 cm with visceral pleura invasion, adjacent lobe invasion, or main bronchus involvement
pathological.pT2b: Tumor > 4 cm but ≤ 5 cm in greatest dimension with or without T2 features
pathological.pT3: Tumor > 5 cm but ≤ 7 cm or invading parietal pleura, chest wall, pericardium, phrenic nerve, or separate nodule in same lobe
pathological.pT4: Tumor > 7 cm or invading mediastinum, heart, great vessels, trachea, esophagus, diaphragm, or separate nodule in different ipsilateral lobe

post_treatment.ycTX: Primary tumor cannot be assessed. (Sputum/washings positive but not visualized)
post_treatment.ycT1: Tumor ≤ 3 cm surrounded by lung/visceral pleura
post_treatment.ycT2: Tumor > 3 cm but ≤ 5 cm or ≤ 4 cm with pleura/bronchus involvement
post_treatment.ycT2a: Tumor > 3 cm but ≤ 4 cm or equivalent features
post_treatment.ycT2b: Tumor > 4 cm but ≤ 5 cm or equivalent features
post_treatment.ycT3: Tumor > 5 cm but ≤ 7 cm or invading chest wall/pericardium
post_treatment.ycT4: Tumor > 7 cm or invading mediastinum/great vessels/diaphragm

clinical.cNX: Los ganglios linfáticos regionales no pueden ser evaluados
clinical.cN0: No hay metástasis en los ganglios linfáticos regionales
clinical.cN1: Metástasis en ganglios linfáticos peribronquiales e hiliares ipsilaterales
clinical.cN2: Metástasis en ganglios linfáticos mediastínicos e hiliares ipsilaterales (incluye subcarinales)
clinical.cN3: Metástasis en ganglios linfáticos contralaterales o supraclaviculares

clinical.cMX: La presencia de metástasis a distancia no puede ser evaluada
clinical.cM1a: Nódulos en pulmón contralateral; derrame pleural/pericárdico maligno; implantes pleurales/pericárdicos
clinical.cM1b: Metástasis a distancia única en un solo órgano
clinical.cM1c: Metástasis a distancia múltiples en uno o más órganos
